title: Coimbatore: Out with friend, PG student abducted, gang-raped near airport; 3 held after encounter
content: A 20-year-old student was abducted and gang-raped in Coimbatore after her car was attacked by three men. The assailants assaulted her boyfriend before taking her to a secluded area. Police apprehended three suspects from Madurai district after a manhunt. The survivor is receiving medical attention, and investigations are ongoing.

title: 'Untenable injustice': US courts halt deportation of Indian-origin man
content: Indian-origin man, Subramanyam Vedam, faces deportation from the US after spending over four decades in prison for a murder conviction later overturned.  Despite being a legal permanent resident since infancy, he was taken into immigration custody upon release. Courts have now halted his deportation, offering a glimmer of hope for the exonerated man.

title: From Lahli to Navi Mumbai: Shafali Verma's return gift to idol Sachin
content: Twelve years after a nine-year-old Shafali Verma begged her father to take her to Lahli to see Sachin Tendulkar, the Rohtak girl returned the favour, gifting her idol a World Cup in his own backyard. With Tendulkar in the stands, Shafali’s bat and ball did the talking as life came full circle.

title: iPhone upgrade alert: iOS 26.1 rollout begins; 9 new features coming this week
content: Apple is releasing iOS 26.1 this week, bringing significant refinements to your iPhone. Key updates include disabling the camera swipe gesture, a redesigned alarm system, and expanded language support for Apple Intelligence and Live Translation. The update also introduces automatic background security updates for enhanced protection.

title: NYC mayoral election: Musk's 'Mumdumi or whatever' jibe at Zohran Mamdani irks fire
content: Elon Musk faces accusations of racism after deliberately misspelling New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani's name while endorsing Andrew Cuomo. Critics pointed to a pattern of ridiculing non-white names, with some suggesting it reflects an "apartheid-brain wiring." Mamdani, whose parents are of Indian origin, could become the city's first Muslim mayor.

title: 'If you are envious…'- DC star hits back at trolls targeting Jemimah's faith
content: Veteran pacer Shikha Pandey defended young batter Jemimah Rodrigues against online trolling after the Women's World Cup final. Rodrigues faced criticism for her post-semi-final comments and subsequent performance, prompting Pandey to issue a strong statement on social media supporting her teammate.

title: AI drama escalates: Sam Altman answers ‘stealing’ claim; Musk mocks $1.4 trillion spend commitments
content: A public spat erupted between Sam Altman and Elon Musk after Musk accused the OpenAI CEO of "stealing" a non-profit. The feud escalated when Altman shared his inability to cancel a Tesla order, prompting Musk's accusation. Altman defended OpenAI's spending and his role in its success, while Musk criticized the company's revenue claims.

title: Stock market holiday on Guru Nanak Jayanti: Will NSE and BSE remain closed on Nov 5?
content: Stock markets, including NSE and BSE, will be closed on Wednesday, November 5, for Guru Nanak Jayanti. This holiday will halt trading across all segments. Normal operations will resume on the following working day. The markets opened on a muted note Tuesday, with Nifty50 and BSE Sensex trading flat.

title: Bopanna retires: Like 'fine wine' he got better with age; gave back to Indian tennis
content: Rohan Bopanna, who retired after a remarkable 22-year career, leaves behind a legacy defined by longevity and persistence. From becoming the oldest Grand Slam, Masters 1000 champion, first-time World No. 1 to mentoring India’s next generation through his academy and initiatives, Bopanna’s journey reflects unwavering passion — proving that true champions give back long after they stop playing.

title: China shuts door: Nvidia CEO warns US risks losing global AI edge
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the US government to reconsider restrictions on China, warning that barring the company from the Chinese market risks ceding AI talent to rivals. Despite significant losses in China due to US export controls, Nvidia is securing major deals with the US Department of Energy, including supercomputers for national security.

title: Midday horror in Bengaluru: Man flashes at woman walking dog on Domlur Road; police launch manhunt
content: A 33-year-old woman in Bengaluru was allegedly sexually harassed by an unidentified man while walking her dog. The accused reportedly flashed and acted obscenely towards her on November 1. Police are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the suspect, and a case has been registered under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Flight chaos across US: 3 million passengers hit as govt shutdown snarls airports
content: A prolonged US government shutdown is causing significant travel chaos, with millions of passengers facing flight delays and cancellations due to absent air traffic controllers.  The situation is straining airport operations, leading to widespread disruptions and prompting concerns about holiday travel.  Industry leaders warn of growing damage and eroding passenger confidence as the crisis continues.

title: Shein bans all sex dolls worldwide; France warned over ‘childlike’ listings
content: Chinese e-commerce giant Shein has announced a global ban on all sex-doll products following accusations from French authorities of selling child-like and pornographic items. The company removed the products immediately and launched an internal review, with its executive chairman taking personal responsibility for the third-party vendor listings.

title: November supermoon 2025: Witness the closest and brightest full moon of the year; tips on how and when to watch
content: Sky watchers will witness a spectacular celestial event on November 6, 2025. The Beaver Moon will be the closest full moon of the year. It will appear larger and brighter than any other moon in 2025. This event offers a rare chance to see the moon in its full glory. Another supermoon will occur on December 6, 2025.

title: Bengaluru horror: Caretaker kills dog by smashing it on lift floor after it barked at her; act caught on CCTV
content: A Bengaluru caretaker, Pushpalatha, brutally killed a chihuahua named Goofy by smashing it against a lift floor after it barked at her. She initially claimed the dog collapsed, but CCTV footage revealed the horrific act.  The 29-year-old has also been accused of stealing jewelry from her employer. The dog will be exhumed for a postmortem.

title: Taylor Swift boosts the security budget by USD 2 million; Billionaire singer remains out of spotlight amid safety concerns
content: Pop superstar Taylor Swift has significantly ramped up her personal security, reportedly spending millions annually, especially for NFL games. This heightened vigilance follows a restraining order against a stalker and concerns sparked by a recent assassination. Swift is now reportedly avoiding the spotlight, with increased measures in place for her safety at events.

title: Lung cancer isn’t just a smoker’s disease, say oncologists and warn on early signs this awareness month
content: Lung Cancer Awareness Month highlights that this disease isn't just for smokers; pollution and genetics also play a role. Early symptoms like a persistent cough are often dismissed, but early detection through screenings like low-dose CT scans is crucial. Quitting smoking, a healthy lifestyle, and regular check-ups significantly reduce risk and improve lung health.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex above 84,000
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,750, BSE Sensex was above 84,000.

title: New York mayoral election: Trump issues 'no funds' warning for NYC if Mamdani wins; backs Cuomo
content: US President Donald Trump warned New York City voters against electing Zohran Mamdani, threatening to withhold federal funds. Trump urged a vote for independent Andrew Cuomo, framing it as a choice between disaster and capability. Mamdani criticized Trump's interference, while Cuomo appeared to welcome the endorsement, though later denied it.

title: How much farting is normal per day? Expert reveals what’s considered healthy
content: Passing gas is natural, with 10 to 20 times daily considered normal. Exceeding this may signal digestive problems or dietary imbalances. Foods like beans and cruciferous vegetables, along with stress and certain medications, can increase gas. Eating slowly, staying hydrated, and exercising can help manage excess gas. Too little gas can also indicate issues with gut movement or enzyme activity, according to Ryan Fernando.

title: November 2025 OTT releases: ‘The Family Man Season 3,’ ‘Delhi Crime Season 3,’ ‘Stranger Things Season 5’ and more
content: November 2025 brings a slate of exciting OTT releases, including the return of 'The Family Man Season 3' on November 2 and 'Delhi Crime Season 3' on November 13. 'Maharani Season 4' premieres on November 7, while 'Stranger Things Season 5' will roll out new episodes starting November 26, promising thrilling political dramas and sci-fi showdowns.

title: Exclusive | 'I was bullied by boys' - Punam says Harmanpreet's WC win silenced old taunt
content: India's maiden Women's World Cup triumph, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, has silenced doubters and fulfilled a long-held dream.  The victory, particularly poignant after the 2017 final loss, signifies a monumental shift for women's cricket in India, proving it's a game for everyone.  Shafali Verma's unexpected yet impactful inclusion also played a crucial role.

title: Chinese goods set to re-enter Indian markets — Why government is allowing it?
content: Chinese goods are set to re-enter Indian markets after a four-year halt in clearances, driven by surging domestic demand fueled by GST rate cuts. The government is expediting pending applications for various products, including electronics and household items, to address supply chain delays and prevent shortages during the festive season.

title: Draya Michele reacts to Travis Kelce’s ex with two-word message after Halloween
content: Kayla Nicole's Halloween portrayal of Toni Braxton's "He Wasn't Man Enough" video sparked social media buzz, with fans interpreting it as a message to ex Travis Kelce.  The performance garnered praise from celebrities like Draya Michele, Angel Reese, and Claire Kittle, while fueling speculation about Nicole's past relationship with Kelce.

title: 2025 Women’s World Cup: Netizens draw parallels with ‘Chak De! India’; calls for a sequel
content: India's Women's World Cup victory has sparked comparisons between coach Amol Muzumdar and Shah Rukh Khan's character Kabir Khan from 'Chak De! India.' Both found redemption and success in coaching after facing personal setbacks. The narrative, culminating on SRK's birthday, mirrors the film's triumphant arc, prompting calls for a sequel.

title: Bihar polls: The ‘ruins of Marhowra’ make jobs a touchy topic
content: Marhowra, once a symbol of Bihar's industrial might with its sugar mill and engineering company, now grapples with defunct factories and job scarcity. Despite new ventures like a diesel locomotive plant, locals seek substantial employment. The revival of old industries remains a distant hope amidst electoral promises and economic challenges.

title: Bank holiday on Guru Nanak Jayanti: Will banks remain closed on Nov 5? Check list
content: Banks across numerous Indian states will be closed on Wednesday, November 5, for Guru Nanak Jayanti and Kartik Purnima. Customers in states like Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal will face branch closures. While digital banking services remain operational, in-person transactions will be unavailable.

title: 'Where were they?'- Furious actor sparks outrage after India’s World Cup win
content: South African actress Thanja Vuur publicly questioned the lack of support from her nation's cricket icons and leaders at the 2025 Women's ODI World Cup final, contrasting it with India's overwhelming fan presence. Her viral Instagram reel highlights a perceived disconnect in valuing women's cricket, sparking debate about national priorities and player recognition.

title: Bengaluru: Man faints after scooter crash; bag with Rs 80L goes missing
content: A steel company employee lost 80 lakh rupees after an incident on his scooter. Waseem Akram fell unconscious near the Cantonment railway bridge underpass. He was carrying a large sum of cash collected from clients. Akram believes he was pushed from behind. An autorickshaw driver found him and took him to the hospital. Police are investigating the incident as theft.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta identifies two top stock picks for November 4, 2025 - Prestige and Sun Pharmaceutical Industries.

title: ‘I killed my wife for you’: Bengaluru doctor tried to woo 4-5 women
content: A doctor, accused of murdering his wife, sent chilling messages to multiple women, including one stating, "I killed my wife for you." He had previously proposed to several women, even faking his death to one. Police are investigating these disturbing communications following his arrest.

title: Fearing fraud: Canada study permit refusal rate to Indians hit 74% in Aug
content: Canada's study permit crackdown disproportionately impacts Indian applicants, with refusal rates soaring to 74% in August 2025. This surge, driven by fraud concerns and stricter verification, has halved Indian applications. Universities report significant enrolment drops, while students now question Canada's long-term settlement prospects, a stark contrast to past 'study, work, stay' assurances.

title: When the body attacks its joints: Expert explains inflammatory arthritis
content: Inflammatory arthritis, where the immune system attacks healthy joints, demands early attention. Watch for persistent joint pain, swelling, morning stiffness exceeding 30 minutes, fatigue, fever, symmetrical pain, and unexplained weight loss. Timely diagnosis and management through medication, gentle exercise, a balanced diet, stress control, and regular check-ups can prevent dependency and ensure active lives.

title: 10 healthy and easy ways to enjoy figs for better digestion and heart function
content: Anjeer, or figs, offer a health boost with their rich fibre, antioxidants, and minerals. They aid digestion, ease constipation, and support heart health by regulating cholesterol and blood pressure. Incorporating fresh, dried, or soaked figs into your diet through various methods like morning rituals, smoothies, or salads can naturally enhance well-being and metabolism.

title: Actress Diane Ladd dies at 89: What is known about the Oscar-nominated ‘Wild at Heart’ actress' death
content: Legendary actress Diane Ladd has died at 89, with her daughter Laura Dern by her side. While no official cause has been confirmed, Ladd had been diagnosed with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) in recent years. Her passing follows the recent death of her husband, Robert Charles Hunter.

title: 'She’s the reason India won': Ashwin can’t stop praising India’s breakout bowler
content: Ravichandran Ashwin lauded young spinner Sree Charani for her exceptional World Cup performance. He believes Charani is a future superstar. Ashwin compared India's 2025 World Cup triumph to historic wins under Kapil Dev and MS Dhoni. He highlighted captain Harmanpreet Kaur's efforts in achieving this milestone. The team's success will be remembered for generations.

title: Prince William joins Brazil beach volleyball with Carolina Solberg
content: Prince William surprised onlookers by playing barefoot volleyball on Copacabana Beach with Olympic player Carolina Solberg. He later teamed up with football legend Cafu, engaging children in environmental lessons through sport. The Prince William's visit highlights his commitment to environmental causes and community engagement ahead of the Earthshot Prize ceremony.

title: 'Killed My Doctor Wife For You': Bengaluru Surgeon's Message To Lover
content: Mahendra Reddy had sent the message to the woman he was in a relationship with on a digital payment application.

title: "Drunk" Cops Behind Wheel Leave Trail Of Injuries In Bhopal, Indore
content: In two separate incidents within hours of each other, police and paramilitary personnel in Madhya Pradesh allegedly drove under the influence of alcohol, rammed civilians, and tried to flee.

title: "We Weren't The First Nor...": Pak Responds To Trump's Claim On Testing Nukes
content: A senior Pakistani official has reaffirmed that Islamabad "will not be the first to resume nuclear tests", responding to US President Donald Trump's recent remark suggesting the South Asian country is secretly testing its nuclear weapons.

title: UP Woman Steals Jewellery Worth Rs 50 Lakh Kept For Sister-In-Law's Wedding
content: A woman here allegedly stole jewellery worth around Rs 50 lakh that had been kept for her sister-in-law's wedding, police said on Tuesday.

title: Prince William To Help Indigenous Defenders Of Brazil's Amazon Rainforest
content: Britain's Prince William will announce on Tuesday a new initiative aimed at supporting Indigenous communities and environmental activists who often risk their lives to protect Brazil's Amazon rainforest.

title: How Islamic State-Inspired Halloween Terror Attack Was Prevented In US
content: Two men were charged with terrorism-related crimes in the Detroit area after federal authorities made arrests and seized a cache of weapons last week in a storage unit and elsewhere, officials said Monday.

title: "You Know What Happened To Me": BJP Leader's Warning For Shashi Tharoor
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor's article critiquing dynasticism in Indian politics has drawn a BJP leader'spraise, and a warning. Shehzad Poonawalla, former Congress leader and now BJP spokesperson, has said Tharoor is "khatron ke khiladi"

title: Rats Burrow Under Indore's Oldest Flyover, Create 5-Foot-Deep Crater
content: Rats burrowed extensively beneath Shastri Bridge, hollowing out the soil. The loose earth gave way, creating a five-foot-deep crater right in front of the Punjab National Bank stretch of the bridge.

title: TV Actor Receives Videos Of Private Parts, Obscene Texts, Accused Arrested
content: It began three months ago when the actor, who works in Telugu and Kannada television serials, received a friend request from a user named 'Naveenz' on Facebook. Though she did not accept the request, the man began sending her vulgar messages.

title: Trump "Threatened" By Us: Mamdani Responds To "Failure" Remark
content: New York City Mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani said US President Donald Trump is "threatened" by his campaign, as the American leader warned voters that the city's "survival" is at risk if the Democratic nominee wins.

title: "Changing Excuses Every Year": Rahul Gandhi Slams BJP Over Delhi's Toxic Air, Party Responds
content: "Now that the BJP rules both at the Centre and in Delhi, there can be no more excuses," Rahul Gandhi said in a social media post.

title: The 2000 Assembly Deadlock: When No Party Could Rule Bihar
content: The 2000 Assembly elections were expected to deliver a decisive mandate, with the rising BJP-led NDA in pole position to wrest power from the RJD.

title: "Complete, Total Failure": Trump Attacks "Communist" Mamdani On Polling Eve
content: US President Donald Trump has endorsed former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo in his independent run for New York City mayor, urging voters not to elect left-wing Democratic front-runner Zohran Mamdani.

title: Delhi's Air Quality Remains In 'Very Poor' Category, AQI Recorded At 309
content: The air quality in the national capital continued to remain in the 'very poor' category on Tuesday morning, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 309 at 7 am, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

title: 1995 Bihar Polls: How 'Vikas Nahi Samman' Won Lalu Yadav Chief Ministership
content: Janata Dal won 167 of 324 seats in the 1995 Bihar polls, securing an absolute majority. The backward castes and Dalits finally felt empowered.

title: India Most Attractive Destination For Entrepreneurs, Says Speaker Om Birla
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said entrepreneurs from across the world are investing in India, describing it as one of the most attractive investment destinations, with every requirement for doing business available in the country.

title: Top Israeli Military Lawyer Quits, Goes Missing, Is Found And Sent To Jail
content: The soap opera-worthy saga was touched off by Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi's explosive admission that she leaked a video appearing to show soldiers abusing a Palestinian detainee.

title: Stubble Burning In Punjab, Haryana Reduced By 50% This Year: Top Expert To NDTV
content: A total of 4,754 stubble burning incidents were recorded in Punjab and Haryana between September 15 and November 2 last year. This year, it has dropped to 2,384.

title: What Charlie Kirk's 3-Year-Old Daughter Said When Told 'Daddy Is In Heaven'
content: After Charlie Kirk's death, his wife, Erika, told her children that their father has gone on a work trip with Jesus.

title: Morant mum on feelings after return from ban
content: Grizzlies star Ja Morant returned from his one-game suspension and had 18 points and 10 assists in a loss to the Pistons.

title: Sources: Ravens deal for Titans edge rusher Jones
content: The Ravens are acquiring edge rusher Dre'Mont Jones from the Titans in exchange for a conditional fifth-round pick, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Jones hints Cowboys already have made trade
content: Jones Jones raised some eyebrows with his comments Monday that insinuated that Dallas has made a deal, even though the Cowboys haven't announced one, and there haven't been reports of a recent transaction involving the team.

title: Conte, architect of BALCO scandal, dies at 75
content: Victor Conte, the architect of a scheme to provide undetectable performance-enhancing drugs to professional athletes, including baseball stars Barry Bonds, Jason Giambi and Olympic track champion Marion Jones decades ago, died Monday. He was 75.

title: C's Brown irate at apparent no-call: 'Unacceptable'
content: Celtics star wing Jaylen Brown was irate after an apparent no-call late in Monday's 105-103 loss to the Utah Jazz that he said "cost us the game."

title: Braves promote bench coach Weiss to manager
content: The Braves on Monday hired Walt Weiss, who has been Atlanta's bench coach since 2018, as their new manager to replace Brian Snitker.

title: Paul-Davis fight off after lawsuit against Davis
content: The exhibition boxing match between Jake Paul and Gervonta Davis, scheduled for Nov. 14 in Miami, has been canceled.

title: Peat wows in debut as Arizona beats No. 3 Florida
content: Freshman Koa Peat scored 30 points to lead No. 13 Arizona to a 93-87 win over third-ranked and reigning national champion Florida in the Hall of Fame Series on Monday night.

title: NFL trade grades: Will Dre'Mont Jones upgrade the Ravens?
content: Let's size up deals leading into the Tuesday NFL trade deadline, including the Ravens getting pass-rush help.

title: Men's 2025-26 season opens with Arizona upsetting Florida, more
content: Koa Peat's 30 points in the Wildcats' win over the reigning champs highlights big night of freshmen debuts.

title: A top-10 upset, Latson's Gamecocks debut and an Iowa breakout: Women's college hoops is back!
content: Baylor's top-10 upset of Duke and Ta'Niya Latson's 20-point debut helped open the women's 2025-26 season Monday.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: Barnwell: Two days after Halloween, four Super Bowl contenders proved to be not-so-scary
content: Have the Bills solved the Chiefs? Did Colts QB Daniel Jones regress? Do the Packers and Lions have underlying concerns, and could either make a trade?

title: Tottenham have big problems; Haaland lifts Man City again; Griezmann scores 200; more
content: All is clearly not well with Tottenham after this weekend's lopsided 1-0 defeat to Chelsea. Plus: Spalletti's Juve debut ends in a win, Erling Haaland keeps scoring for Man City and Antoine Griezmann hits 200.

title: Power Rankings: Does anyone stand a chance against KC?
content: The 2025 NWSL regular season is in the rearview mirror, so ESPN takes a look at the eight playoff teams and ranks them from first to worst.

title: AP Week 10 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: There wasn't much drama in the top 5, with Alabama and Texas A&M idle, but Georgia did squeak out a win.

title: Buzz: What is Jayden Daniels' injury outlook going forward?
content: Look beyond the fantasy points leaderboard to see who got the carries, the targets and the opportunities.

title: Kyle Larson's NASCAR Cup crown comes at Denny Hamlin's heartbreaking expense
content: Kyle Larson won his second NASCAR title on Sunday, but even he didn't feel right seeing another championship slip through Denny Hamlin's fingers.

title: First bets for Week 10: Browns and Eagles to cover in Week 10, plus an MVP pick
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool to sign Fulham's Kevin?
content: After a fine start to Fulham this season, Liverpool are keeping tabs on their forward Kevin. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Sengottaiyan urges ECI to expedite inquiry into ‘Two Leaves’ symbol issue
content: Sengottaiyan tells ECI that the faction led by Edappadi K. Palaniswami does not represent the original AIADMK

title: Voting goes underway for JNUSU elections
content: Counting will begin at 9 p.m., and the final results will be declared on November 6, according to the election committee.

title: CPJ seeks security for journalist Rana Ayyub and her father
content: “The threats of violence made against Rana Ayyub and her father from an unknown international number are deeply concerning,” said CPJ’s India representative Kunal Majumder

title: Fugitive Mehul Choksi challenges extradition in Belgium Supreme Court
content: India has given a number of assurances to Belgium regarding Choksi's safety, the charges that he would face during trial in India, prison arrangements, human rights and medical needs.

title: Magnitude 3.7 earthquake in Alluri District, gives tremors to residents in nearby Vizag city
content: “On November 4, 2025, at 4.19.41 am, an earthquake of magnitude 3.7 was recorded at a depth of 10 km in ASR district. This is a minor earthquake of low intensity” IMD Amaravati Director S.Stella told The Hindu.

title: Kerala Waqf Board to challenge HC Division Bench’s verdict on Munambam land
content: A two-member Bench consisting of Justice Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari and Justice V. M. Shyamkumar had passed the judgment last month in a writ petition filed by the State government challenging a Single Judge’s order striking down the appointment of an inquiry commission into the Munambam issue.

title: First Juvenile Huntington’s Disease brain donated to NIMHANS for research
content: The deceased, Jagadeesha, who hailed from Kalagotla village in Yemmiganur mandal of Kurnool district, Andhra Pradesh, was first evaluated at NIMHANS in 2017

title: Coimbatore gang rape: Police arrest three men after shooting them in the legs during escape bid
content: Coimbatore City Police Commissioner A. Saravana Sundar said the police team shot in their legs when they “attempted to escape”

title: ‘Demands to be discussed with CM within 15 days’: Jain monk ends indefinite fast over pigeon feeding issue in Mumbai
content: After the Bombay HC order, the BMC recently allowed controlled feeding of pigeons at four locations — Worli Reservoir, the mangrove area on Lokhandwala Back Road in Andheri West, the Airoli-Mulund check post area, and Gorai ground in Borivali West

title: CM Bhupendra Patel visits rain-affected Gujarat villages, reviews crop damage
content: Unseasonal rains that began in the last week of October damaged crops in several districts. Survey operations were launched to assess the extent of damage

title: Coimbatore gang-rape: a hang-out for anti-social elements that turned into a crime scene
content: The vacant areas along a mud road linking Brindhavan Nagar and SIHS Colony have become a hotspot for drinking, substance abuse: residents

title: Haryana cabinet approves job support for families of 1984 anti-Sikh riot victims
content: In another decision, the cabinet approved the Teachers' Transfer Policy, 2025, replacing the existing Teachers' Transfer Policy, 2023

title: Restructuring of Panjab University’s senate-syndicate has exposed ‘BJP’s anti-Punjab face’, says ex-Cong min
content: Mr. Sidhu stated that under the pretext of improving the functioning of Panjab University, the Central government has almost eliminated the representation of teachers, principals, and alumni in its syndicate

title: Dynastic politics 'grave threat' to Indian democracy: Shashi Tharoor
content: Mr. Tharoor said that when political power is determined by lineage rather than ability, commitment, or grassroots engagement, the quality of governance suffers

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Modi invokes katta jibe again, Priyanka slams PM, Kharge says Nitish ‘in BJP’s lap’
content: All top leaders of the NDA and Mahagathbandhan were busy touring Bihar and trading barbs as the campaign for the polls intensified

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta heads to Bihar for three-day campaigning in Assembly polls
content: Ms. Gupta will address a public meeting in Bankipur Assembly constituency, after reaching the State capital Patna. She will also campaign in Siwan, Barharia, Baikunthpur and nearby areas on 4 November

title: BJP delegation meets ECI officials, demands vetting of Bengal government’s citizenship documents for SIR
content: The memorandum submitted by the BJP leadership to the ECI stated that ground realities in West Bengal are different from Bihar and alleged that the State has witnessed large-scale issuance of backdated and forged documents which should be vetted during SIR

title: Take proactive steps to reduce pollution, SC tells authorities
content: Amicus curiae and senior advocate Aparajita Singh highlighted media reports indicating that several air quality monitoring stations in Delhi had not functioned during the Deepavali festival days.

title: Former BJD Rajya Sabha MP Amar Patnaik joins BJP
content: Months ago, Patnaik, a former accountant general, played key role in leading BJD’s charge on alleged discrepancy and irregularities in 2024 elections and how it benefited BJP

title: Mushrooms key to achieving nutritional security, says UAS-B VC
content: ‘Even though mushroom cultivation is a promising venture, the existing market in India was very limited compared to China and other countries’

title: M.P. govt. wants to opt out of decentralised procurement system
content: Congress slams Bharatiya Janata Party government, accuses it of betraying farmers and pushing them “into a serious crisis”; State says “government is committed to purchasing every grain“

title: Bombay HC clears way for 26/11 mastermind Abu Jundal’s trial
content: Judge quashes order passed by trial court asking the authorities to produce documents related to the arrest of the accused

title: Karnataka announces ₹600 crore fund to push ‘Deep Tech Decade’
content: This initiative reflects our vision to create a robust DeepTech pipeline supporting entrepreneurs working on technologies such as AI, ML, quantum computing, advanced manufacturing, robotics, and sustainability-driven innovation, says Priyank Kharge

title: BJP formed govt. with stolen votes, alleges former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik
content: BJP government is not a game-changer but a name-changer — a government busy only in rebranding welfare schemes started during BJD government, claims Patnaik

title: Researchers at IIT-M and Ohio State varsity develop AI framework that mimics real-time chemical synthesis
content: They say the framework, named PURE, promises to cut down early stage timelines of drug development, which is sometimes a decades-long process that costs millions of dollars

title: Set up SIT to probe doctor’s death, Supriya Sule urges Fadnavis
content: Doctors’ association calls for systemic reforms to ensure the mental well-being of medical professionals serving in government healthcare institutions

title: Cong government spared no one in its cheating: KTR
content: He said the the government was targeting the poor through the HYDRAA drive, which would raze houses in Borabanda as well if the ruling party secures the seat

title: Allahabad High Court orders ₹50,000 compensation for man jailed in false anti-conversion case
content: The Bench said the case was an example of the “State authorities falling and scrambling over each other in order to score brownie points” on the basis of an FIR

title: SIR is a hurried exercise that aims to terrorise people of West Bengal, says TMC
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will lead a rally in protest against SIR in Kolkata on Tuesday, while the LoP Suvendu Adhikari will be lead a rally in Panihati supporting the SIR

title: Delhi High Court upholds FSSAI ban on sale of beverages with ‘ORS’ branding
content: The Delhi High Court upholds the FSSAI’s order barring companies from using the label ‘ORS’, citing serious health risks for consumers

title: Families of Indians fighting Russia’s war with Ukraine protest, demand safe return of kin
content: The protesting family members said that agents ‘lured’ young men with lucrative job offers and promise of citizenship, and they were sent to the war zone

title: Air India flight diverted to Mongolia due to a technical glitch
content: The airline said that the Boeing 777-300 aircraft was undergoing checks, and it was making efforts to take passengers to their destination

title: Need for shift in focus from food security to nutrition security: PM
content: Modi addresses experts at first Emerging Science Technology and Innovation Conclave, which replaces the Indian Science Congress

title: Farmers’ groups question new tractor emission norms
content: They opposed TREM-IV and TREM-V emission norms for tractors as they could severely increase economic burdens and hardships for farmers

title: Transwomen face closure of shelter as govt. allegedly delays payment of funds
content: The residents, eight transwomen including college students, say they are facing uncertainty over food and shelter as the trust wants them to move out, unwilling to run the shelter home without adequate funds

title: We are one step away from solving climate change: Chemistry Laureate
content: The country is extremely well positioned to build on an innovative sense, said the Scottish chemist, David MacMillan

title: Lakshadweep woman out of danger after treatment for new amoebic brain infection variant, says hospital
content: The patient, who works in Edappally, had been admitted three weeks ago with a severe headache, vomiting, and an eye movement disorder

title: GBA Chief orders urgent action as city misses CM’s pothole deadline
content: He has directed senior officials of all city corporations to personally inspect the roads, identify damaged stretches, and take swift action to fill potholes

title: Kerala Chief Minister to inaugurate KIIFB silver jubilee celebrations on Tuesday
content: According to the Kerala government, KIIFB has to date approved 1,190 projects worth ₹90,562 crore across various sectors

title: ‘Supposed’ trade deal with U.S. seems to have become an ordeal for India, says Congress
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh says there was a time when it looked like India would host the Quad Summit but that was unlikely now

title: Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls begins in 12 States, Union Territories on November 4
content: This major exercise will cover close to 51 crore voters. The first round of the clean-up exercise was carried out in Bihar earlier this year, during which more than 68 lakh names were deleted from the electoral rolls.

title: Hibi to send letter to Health Minister demanding handover of Corporation building to Ernakulam GH
content: A few members of the Hospital Development Committee (HDC) have also expressed interest in acquiring the premises, citing its potential to ease space constraints and improve healthcare services

title: Unity remains key challenge for UDF in Malappuram
content: In the 2020 elections, the UDF maintained its unity in most local bodies in Malappuram. However, it faced internal conflicts in panchayats such as Ponmundam, Karuvarakundu and Makkaraparamba, where the Congress and Indian Union Muslim League had disagreements despite reconciliation efforts by the UDF leadership

title: Andhra Pradesh targets ₹9.8 lakh cr MoUs, 7.5 lakh jobs at CII Partnership Summit 2025
content: Minister Nara Lokesh says focus on Speed of Doing Business and industry-friendly policies has positioned Andhra Pradesh as a top investment destination; major projects by Google and ArcelorMittal to boost investor confidence

title: Adilabad Collector asked to acquire 700 acres of land for development of joint user Airport in Adilabad
content: The initiative would fulfill the long-cherished dream of denizens of Adilabad district and its surrounding areas for air passenger connectivity

title: 14 dead as dumper truck ploughs into multiple vehicles in Rajasthan
content: The police said the driver hit a car, prompting locals to chase him. He accelerated further, hitting pedestrians and bikers along the road. He then stopped after colliding with a trailer truck and a car on the Delhi-Ajmer Highway. It is suspected he was under the influence of alcohol.

title: Alcobev firms want Telangana govt. to clear dues by Nov. 10 to avoid shortfall in supplies
content: Three bodies representing the alcoholic beverage companies urge govt. to pay outstanding using new retail licence application fee; the firms otherwise will not be able to meet December demand

title: ‘Govt. working on making mental health part of school education system’
content: Samagra Shiksha Assistant State Project Director highlighted the State government’s commitment to nurturing the emotional and career growth of students

title: Steep reduction in employment through MGNREG scheme in Telangana
content: Report by LibTech India finds sharp decline of 47.6% in the number of person days generated when compared to the same period last year; resultant wage loss at State level amounts to ₹802.57 crore

title: Kerala State Film Awards: words paved the way for Shamla Hamza to cinema
content: Shamla Hamza initially pursued a career as a lyricist, but unexpectedly transitioned to acting at an audition for the film 1001 Nunakal. Her performance led her to be cast in Feminichi Fathima, in which she portrays a woman who perseveres in a quiet way against patriarchal and religious oppression to make true a simple wish.

title: LIC Housing Finance sets ₹4,250-crore home loan target for Andhra Pradesh in FY 2025–26
content: Company achieves ₹1,628 crore in first half; MD Tribhuwan Adhikari says special focus on Andhra Pradesh with dedicated marketing head in Vijayawada as LIC HFL posts steady national growth in Q2

title: Delhi High Court urges Centre to act swiftly for return of Indian student detained in Ukraine
content: The 22-year-old youth’s mother apprehends that he has been duped into fighting for the Russian forces in the country’s war with Ukraine. The court granted four weeks to the Centre to submit a status report that specifies the steps taken on the plea made by the mother.

title: With an eye on future, Osama has a past to contend with
content: Osama Shahab, the son of the late gangster-turned-MP Mohammad Shahabuddin, is a reticent politician who is trying his best to connect with the local people despite his father’s dreaded past

title: Cash, liquor, drugs worth over ₹100 crore seized: Election Commission
content: A total of 824 flying squads have been deployed across Bihar to ensure that complaints reported on C-VIGIL app are attended to within 100 minutes, says ECI

title: No chargesheets yet in CSR funds scam cases
content: In September, police had said chargesheets were being prepared on the ADGP’s instructions to file them without delay

title: President Droupadi Murmu hails Uniform Civil Code of Uttarakhand
content: The President addresses special session of Uttarakhand Assembly marking silver jubilee celebrations of the formation of the State

title: Project to promote Kuttiady coconut gets a shot in the arm
content: The involvement of the Responsible Tourism Mission Society is expected to replicate the ‘Kumarakom model’ in Kuttiady, wherein everything associated with this elite variety of coconut palms and the orchards will unfold a bundle of tourism opportunities

title: SCR nears completion of key third-line projects to boost rail capacity
content: The most important among them is the 219-km Vijayawada-Kazipet third-line project, spanning both Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, at a cost of ₹1,952 crore

title: Auto drivers in Hubballi want travel booking apps to be restricted to Bengaluru

title: Plea for 5-J bench: SC slams govt’s request; seems Centre wants to avoid my bench, says CJI
content: govt's request to refer to five-judge bench petitions challenging the constitutional validity of Tribunal Reforms Act . a bench led by cJI B R Gavai said it was shocking for the Centre to make this request after the petitioners concluded arguments . "we do not expect the Union of India to take such a stand and play tactics with the court," a lawyer says .

title: 12 OD deaths in India every week: NCRB
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: How Gujarat hospital footage ended up on porn market
content: Ashish Chauhan is Assistant Editor with The Times of India, Ahmedabad, with over 15 years of experience in crime, legal, and political reporting. He covers human smuggling, cyber fraud, and caste violence, and has broken major stories on fake IPLs and exam rackets. A former PTI and Gujarat Samachar journalist, he focuses on investigative, impact-driven journalism. Read More

title: Jayden Daniels' elbow injury: Answering the most pressing questions
content: the Washington Commanders' ugly season got a whole lot worse . Jayden Daniels was lying on the ground, in pain, after suffering a dislocated elbow . the commanders have been devastated by injuries and player absences since training camp opened .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Dre'Mont Jones to the Ravens, Jaelan Phillips to the Eagles
content: the 2025 trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET . we have you covered on every deal until the final second . a team of reporters has the latest buzz on which players could be moved next and which teams might be looking to upgrade .

title: Cardinals finally win: Here's what to know from Week 9, including our main takeaways
content: quarterback Lamar Jackson delivered four touchdown passes in his return from a hamstring injury that sidelined him for three games . the Ravens squeaked by the Falcons after kicker Parker Romo missed a potential tying extra point attempt in the fourth quarter . quarterback Tyler Shough won his fifth straight regular-season matchup against Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes .

title: CFP top 12: One last projection before the first committee ranking
content: defending national champion Ohio State should start the first college football playoff rankings on Tuesday . there could be some debate over the top spot when the 12 members of this year's group vote on teams for their first official top 25 ranking of the season . the bigger discussion will likely revolve around one-loss Alabama and undefeated Texas A&M for the no. 3 and no. 4 spots .

title: Resetting the CFP tiers after Week 10 and projecting the first bracket
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .

title: 'It felt like a toxic environment': Stories from four QBs and their 15 schools
content: despite the haters, we've reached a peak moment for journeyman quarterbacks across college football . nearly 40 quarterbacks from the 2020 class came back this year for one more season at the FBS level . they're 23- and 24-year-old grizzled veterans who feel even older inside their locker rooms .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Ranking: Oregon moves into top 5
content: arch Manning waited until the last possible second before firing the ball to a leaping Emmett Mosley V in the end zone . the longhorns held on for a 34-31 win . he has 674 passing yards and six touchdowns in his past two starts .

title: Cardinals snap losing streak, beat Cowboys in Dallas
content: the Arizona Cardinals ' five-game losing streak was snapped in rather impressive fashion . it brought back memories from earlier in the season when Arizona gave away games in the fourth quarter . the Cardinals' offense looked better and more efficient, both statistically and to the naked eye .

title: Greatest World Series ever? No question for Dodgers-Blue Jays
content: apologies to 1991, the Los Angeles Dodgers and Toronto Blue Jays just finished the greatest World Series . it was the greatest world series because of its compelling storylines, some of which were impossible to believe . the first pinch-hit grand slam in World Series history was the first game to begiard .

title: Premier League 'Big Six' grades: Arsenal an A; Liverpool a D
content: the 2025-26 premier league season has reached a key stage . the so-called traditional "Big Six" have experienced wildly contrasting fortunes on their way to the 10-game mark . every top-flight team have now played 10 league games . four managers have already been fired .
